p: Figures 10 and 11 show that, in the presence of D. brazzae and A. bettzickiana aqueous extracts, red blood cells (RBCs) have a circular (biconcave) and normal shape indicating the antisickling effect of these extracts. This situation, in vitro activity, confirms the in vivo effect observed by traditional healers when using an aqueous decoction of these medicinal plants in the management of sickle cell disease in Kikwit city.
